posts.cooked:
Here is the cleaned-up version of your text:

This Sheet is private.

I created a spreadsheet that compares all available Commercial, off-the-shelf (COTS) swerve modules on the market (that I know of) with various specifications. Some inconsistencies exist in the listed manufacturer values, particularly for MAXSwerve height and Swerve XS weight, due to miscalculations based on motor dimensions. For MAXSwerve and Swerve XS, weight uses a NEO-550 motor. If you have feedback or suggestions for another comparison metric or additional modules, please let me know!

posts.cooked: You should add wheel size to the spreadsheet
Already there, see row 6.
Thrifty swerve wheel size should be 4, not 3.5.
I just measured in the CAD: https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/0/8/0882cc63ed27db80cdc6e908c35104581a237dd1.jpeg
Never mind; I see now. The size is supposed to include the treads. Fixed now.
MAXSwerve can technically run an HD Hex on the azimuth.

posts.cooked:
The Thrifty Bot 2023 - 2024 Product Releases & Updates include gear ratio options with the module or as an additional purchase for teams. Things become more expensive once other ratios are needed.  

If it’s possible to buy an X1/X2/X3 ratio set without purchasing more Swerve X/X Flipped/XS modules, that would be great. Currently, extra gear ratios for all WCP swerve modules are listed separately on their respective buying pages, but I haven’t found them listed individually.

link_counts.title: The Thrifty Bot 2023 - 2024 Product Releases & Updates

posts.cooked: For motor support I’ve gone with what the manufacturer website lists. That’s why Kraken X60 isn’t listed for MAXSwerve even though people have done it. According to REV’s website Features... Azimuth driven by NEO 550 Brushless Motor & UltraPlanetary Gearbox... So I think I won’t list that as an option.

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: good thinking!
This is cool but I believe the Mk4i is corner biased, per SDS: “The MK4i is the flipped motor, corner biased version of the MK4 module.”
I don’t understand what corner biased means. I thought it meant that there were different versions for different corners, like the mk4n.

posts.name: Paul Regnier
posts.cooked: Corner biased means the wheel is moved towards the corner of the frame, where tubing would be if the module was not corner biased. I believe every current module but the normal Mk4 and SwerveX uninverted are corner biased.
SwerveX (and XS and flipped) has both tube and corner mount. The tube mount isn't corner-biased, while the corner mount is corner-biased.

posts.name: Paul Regnier
posts.cooked: SwerveX and SwerveX2 (but not XS) are available in either corner biased or non-corner biased configurations. (Sorry for very late response.)
